You both studied at Northern Arizona University
You both studied at Northern Arizona University from 2005 to 2006

I am a member of the Experience Design and Engineering team concentrating on user interfaces and user experience (UI/UX), workflow and process enhancement, and enterprise transformation.I primarily focus on building Visualizations (D3, Monte.js) and Web-based applications in the SPA (single page application) style of modern web applications primarily using Angular 2 and Vue.js.I typically serve as the lead developer and provide technical decision making support to technical leads and project leads. Responsibilities vary by project, but have included: framework, library, and tooling selections; project architecture; source control management (branching using GitFlow approach, approval of Pull Requests); standards setting / coding conventions; and mentoring junior developers.Secondary roles include recruiting, mentoring, education program curating for junior developers, designing UIs and visualizations.Some of those applications include:* corporate management dashboard;* regulatory insights and data visualizations;* mobile app for a bank (FirstBank); * marketing tools, one for enterprise marketing professionals and a self-serve tool for SMBs to edit and deploy online ads and campaigns;* advanced real estate research application that provides property details, homeowner information, and mortgage insight;* tool for software project graphical design and review; and* Halo Waypoint gaming portal, for Halo 4 an Xbox platform leading game.Some of the advanced components of those applications include:* Linked multiview data exploration;* Custom graphing and charting solutions using Canvas and SVG (D3.js and KineticJS); * Custom drag and drop workflow editors for sophisticated targeted marketing tools; and* Custom WYSIWYG HTML editor from scratch for online advertising customers.Current technologies / tooling:ES6, Babel, Angular 2, Vue.js, D3, Monte, Tape, Bootstrap, SCSS/CSS, npm, Grunt, ESLint, Git, Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence, Stash/BitBucket)

KPMG US acquired Cynergy in March 2014 to form the Digital and Mobile Solutions (now named Experience Design and Engineering) group. See KPMG listing for details covering Cynergy projects that continued under KPMG.Primary technologiesJavaScript: Angular 1, Angular Material, Backbone, Marionette, Cordova.NET: C# 4, WPF, ASP.NET MVC4, EF [Entity] Code First and Model First

Served in a variety of roles that supported development of Rescue21 (the search and rescue system for the US Coast Guard), development of our internal tools, and continual process improvement. Participated in all stages of software and system development: analysis, requirements, design, implementation, and testing.TASKS / ROLES:* Desktop applications* Build automation* Specialized developer tools* Specialized process integration tools* Web development* Mobile application development (Secondary Role)SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT TECHNOLOGIES:* Desktop / Service Development   + Perl   + C# / WPF, .NET Framework   + WCF    + Java   + Ruby (Secondary Task)   + Managed C++ (Secondary Task)* Web Development   + Java   + XML, XSLT   + HTML   + CSS   + JavaScript / AJAX* Mobile Development   + Android   + iOS / Objective-C (Secondary Task)TOOLS and PROCESS INTEGRATION:* IBM Rational ClearCase (version control)* IBM Rational ClearQuest (ticketing system)* SmartBear Code Collaborator (code review system)

Overview:The program provides the knowledge and skills needed to work as a software engineer or software task leader on both large and small projects using either agile methodologies or formal CMMi approaches. The program addresses major software development methodologies, techniques, tools and processes for both developing and managing software projects. (Overview description taken from: http://asuonline.asu.edu/degree-programs/graduate/master-science-engineering-engineering-science-concentration-software)Applied Project: Control for remote time lapse camera operationsThe project was a multi-tiered project featuring a web application layer, a RESTful web service layer, and a microcontroller layer that ran a minimalist RESTful interface. The various technologies in the project include:  HTML5, CSS3, Angular JS, Bootstrap, jQuery, LESS, and custom canvas controls, ASP.NET MVC4, SQL Server DB, Entity Framework Code First approach. The microcontroller used was an Arduino Uno.

summary: The world has complex problems and a lot of data. We can solve problems faster when aided by software and data visualized in meaningful ways. I do my part by writing great software, creating advanced visualizations, and implementing solutions in a user-centric manner.I thrive when writing tools that improve processes and workflows for organizations; helping transform the way analysts, researchers, executives, and everyone in between accomplish their work. To that end I am currently spending most of my time developing advanced web applications with compelling data visualizations written in D3.While I am a versatile developer that is comfortable wearing many hats, I am focused on growing into a leader and visualization expert. I avoid labels such as "fullstack"​ or "frontend" that pigeon hole my roles and instead favor open-ended titles and tackling the tasks at hand.I have written services; designed and implemented software build automation and verification systems; and defined software development processes and built accompanying tooling to support, encourage, as well as enforce process adherence. I prefer to be technology agnostic picking the best tool for the job though web clients have been my focus as of late.I am interested in human centric computing, data visualization, clean/green technologies, and cloud computing. The challenge of hard problems, agile teams, and cutting edge technology are my idea of a good time.In my personal time I have various projects including running Ubuntu-based OpenStack IaaS systems; Raspberry Pi controlled time-lapse photography machines; Arduinos and DIY electronics; home automation and IoT; and NHL Statistics. Just to name a few.
